transcripts.text: It was this video posted exclusively by K24 TV on social media that sparked uproar.  In the video, the man now identified as Deng Hailan, a senior chef at Chez Wu restaurant in Keleleshua, is seen canning a staff member for arriving at work late.  And today, the suspect presented himself to the police and recorded a statement through his lawyer, Dennis Onyango, and he is expected to be arraigned tomorrow.

It's fundamental for people to know at this very moment that the accused person, the one who was trending on social media yesterday, the whole of yesterday, is still very innocent.  Our laws say that you are presumed to be innocent until you are proven guilty.

At the same time, the DCI, through its Twitter page, has indicated that it raided the restaurant this morning and arrested four Chinese nationals, as well as taking its workers to their offices for further investigations into the allegations.  Workers at the restaurant which serves Chinese food claim this is the kind of mistreatment that they have been subjected to time and again.  In a tweet, the Chinese embassy supported the Kenyan police investigations into the matter, insisting that whoever will violate the law will face legal consequences.
